intro: Stylocoryna webera var. montana, commonly known as the mountain stylocoryna, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
